content: It is difficult to choose just one landmark to recommend as they are all incredibly unique and special in their own ways. However, if you are visiting Rome for the first time, I would recommend visiting the Colosseum as it is one of the most famous landmarks and a symbol of the city. Its immense size and historical significance will leave you in awe, and you will gain a great understanding of ancient Roman civilization. Additionally, the Colosseum is conveniently located near other landmarks such as the Roman Forum and Palatine Hill, so you can easily explore the surrounding areas afterwards.
